Ah.. the latest image tom posted on patreon is a jpg instead of a png
rip
whoops
And what's the problem with JPG?
I noticed this. But I do not see any problems with JPG.
Short answer is PNGs are higher quality than JPGs and dont lose any quality when theyre saved then opened again.
Phoenix is right. Also, PNG uses a different format to save than JPGs
In theory, you are right.
it's not just theory, it's effective in practice too
https://yadi.sk/i/bgjfweSb3ZnGbQ
JPGs use pixels for their data, while PNGs do not
so if you increase the size of a jpg, you end up with jpeg artifacts as it were
making the image unclear and not very nice to look at
but pngs can have their size increased far more while still retaining similar quality
I took PNG. He saved it as JPG. Then I connected the two versions together and saved them as PNG. Can you say that the right side of the frame is an original PNG or JPG?
for what you did, it'd be hard to tell, but that's because you're not actually giving it a fair comparison to begin with xD
Why difficult. In theory, half of the image that was saved in the JPG must have terrible artifacts.
Like I said, you didn't give it a fair comparison, so it's not going to be easy to tell with how you did it
This is zoomed in on the jpeg and png version. You can easily tell which one is which https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/250139544517607424/474109330640338945/dllhost_2018-08-01_02-00-53.png
one has artifacts and jagged lines
the other is not as bad
Okay. How about this test. I save PNG as JPG. And then I save both versions as BMP. You can tell which of these two files have JPG artifacts?
https://yadi.sk/i/RfXrJ_jR3ZnHtP
https://yadi.sk/i/0D_-SNhh3ZnHuk
I think bgrs already made the point lol
Your example is stupid. Because the JPG quality depends on settings. If you choose the worst settings, the artifacts will be horrible.
It's not stupid, Iliar. That's how it works. Jpgs are coded different from PNGs in how they save the image data.
100% jpg quality will still have artifacts
if expanded enough
and will degrade in quality if you change it
You did not answer. Which of the two BMP files have JPG artifacts?
they both do iliar
Really?
yeah. they do
and it's really bad
LOL wow Iliar
That's so cheeky lmao
xD
I honestly didnt bother checking
Hahaha
I mean.. you save a png as a jpg.. of course it's going to gain artifacts
and then from jpg to bmp just increases the file size really cuz they both save the image data the same way if I recall correctly
or close to it
But in another version I saved png as a bmp. In this version should not contain artifacts.
bmp is based on pixels just like jpegs are
bitmaps are what ppl use to make like pixel art and stuff xD
Why do you think that another version also has JPG artifacts?
png is based on pixels foo. png is not vector image.
the only reason they're called jpeg artifacts is because when you increase a jpeg in size, the pixels aren't suited for upscale
bitmaps get artifacts too
of course png is based on pixels, but it stores the image data differently than standard ones like jpg and such
it also saves a lot more, tis why they're bigger
jpegs are compressed to save space
a lot of space.
and that compression is lossy, thats why you get artifacts
specifically sharp transitions in color space cause something called "ringing"
because the compression algorithm is based on a fourier decomposition of pixel space
its much less noticeable on pictures with soft transitions
as is typical for photographs
BMP is a format without compression and without loss. I save PNG as BMP. Why do you think that this file has JPG artifacts?
because I can SEE artifacts in both images you posted xD
I have eyes!
:ptv-excited:
Just in case, I want to clarify. Do you know what this button does? https://yadi.sk/i/UyB889nE3ZnKrH
yeah, I do
And did you save the file before opening it?
the site has the full image displayed
when you click it, it gives a preview
You a an idiot.
You looked at the preview of the file.
please tell me you're joking. the file is going to be the same thing. I'll go download the thing right now and go to the same spot
and find the same artifacts
Preview in JPG.
Download the BPM files and compare them again.
I did, and I can see artifcts in both, though A is much less so, going to presume A was the PNG
Also, comparing it to the original png, the bitmap of A has a worse transition
from one color to another
it's abrupt
like the boy's hair to keith's  shirt
You're right. But in my opinion, the difference is very small, that would be greatly upset getting JPG version.
many people upscale the images and use them for wallpapers, or print them and have them framed on their wall
so it being a jpg kind of removes both of those possibilities
Я не понимаю, что ты имеешь в виду? https://yadi.sk/i/SmIghNw-3ZnMG4
JPG removes?
When you print a poster, the biggest problem is a low resolution.
JPG does a little worse, but is not a big problem.
I'm just going to leave this here http://www.differencebetween.info/difference-between-bmp-and-png
and this "Also, as a bitmap image is a pixel by pixel image, if one tries to zoom in or enhance a bitmap picture, the image seems pixilated."
jpg isn't a problem if it's big enough where the size won't give you artifacts, but generally it will because it doesn't save all the data in a jpg
kind of like lossy audio, the more you save and transfer it, the more distorted the sound becomes
jpgs do the same
If you compare the original PSD and public PNG then you will realize - the biggest problem, Tom publish result in less resolution. https://yadi.sk/i/am6zL5XM3ZnP7F
In comparison with this, the difference between PNG and JPG very low.
of course resolution is a big factor, but that's a completely separate thing that can both combine and compound the problems with a jpg lol

In my opinion, the dispute between JPG and PNG looks like a dispute, which is better than Cola with a temperature of 24.8 °C or 25.1 °C. In theory, 24.8 °C is cooler and means better. But in my opinion it does not matter, because both versions are warm
